subsection.name: Description
subsection.p: Checks that a variable has a Javadoc comment. Ignores serialVersionUID fields.

tr.td: Specify the visibility scope where Javadoc comments are not checked.
Specify the regexp to define variable names to ignore.
Specify the visibility scope where Javadoc comments are checked.

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: By default, this setting will report a violation if there is no javadoc for any scope member.
To configure the check for public scope:
This setting will report a violation if there is no javadoc for public member.
To configure the check for members which are in private, but not in protected scope:
subsection.source: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="JavadocVariable"> <property name="scope" value="private"/> <property name="excludeScope" value="protected"/> </module> </module> </module>
subsection.p: This setting will report a violation if there is no javadoc for private member and ignores protected member.
To ignore absence of Javadoc comments for variables with names log or logger:
This setting will report a violation if there is no javadoc for any scope member and ignores members with name log or logger.

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
